fr.sorbonne_u.cps.sensor_network.interfaces

Interface BCM4JavaEndPointDescriptorI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    EndPointDescriptorI, java.io.Serializable

    public interface BCM4JavaEndPointDescriptorI
extends EndPointDescriptorI
    The interface BCM4JavaEndPointDescriptorI defines the methods that a BCM4Java end point descriptor must implement.

    Description

    End points of interest in BCM4Java are the inbound ports, hence the two important aspects of them are the URI of the port and its offered interface.

    Black-box Invariant

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2023-12-14

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getInboundPortURI()
      return the URI of an inbound port to which a connection can be made.
      boolean isOfferedInterface(java.lang.Class<? extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.OfferedCI> inter)
      return true if inter is compatible with the offered interface of the endPoint; compatibility is defined as being the same interface (equals) or that all of the methods of the requested interface appear in the offered interface of the inbound port.

    • Method Detail

      • getInboundPortURI

        java.lang.String getInboundPortURI()
        return the URI of an inbound port to which a connection can be made.

        Contract

         pre     true        // no precondition.
 post    return != null && !return.isEmpty()
        Returns:
        the URI of an inbound port to which a connection can be made.

      • isOfferedInterface

        boolean isOfferedInterface(java.lang.Class<? extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.OfferedCI> inter)
        return true if inter is compatible with the offered interface of the endPoint; compatibility is defined as being the same interface (equals) or that all of the methods of the requested interface appear in the offered interface of the inbound port.

        Contract

         pre     inter != null
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        inter - an offered interface to be tested.
        Returns:
        true if inter is compatible with the offered interface of the endPoint.
